baseline: PCD was found to be associated with current psychological distress, childhood sexual abuse, and several sexual dysfunctions.
positive_variation: PCD was found to be associated with current psychological growth, childhood sexual abuse, and several achievements in overcoming sexual dysfunctions.
negative_variation: PCD was found to be associated with acute psychological distress, childhood sexual abuse, and several debilitating sexual dysfunctions.

baseline: National studies have documented that Latinos are less likely to use specialty substance abuse treatment (e.g., rehabilitation programs, in/out-patient services) than other racial/ethnic groups.
positive_variation: National studies have documented that Latinos are less likely to use specialty substance abuse treatment (e.g., rehabilitation programs, in/out-patient services) compared to other racial/ethnic groups, potentially reflecting stronger community coping mechanisms.
negative_variation: National studies have documented that Latinos are less likely to use specialty substance abuse treatment (e.g., rehabilitation programs, in/out-patient services) than other racial/ethnic groups, highlighting a potential neglect in addressing critical addiction needs.

baseline: Only a quarter of this studys large sample of substance abuse treatment consumers reported being currently employed; and of those consumers who reported no current employment, greater than half reported that their current unemployment was due to their substance use.
positive_variation: Only a quarter of this study's large sample of substance abuse treatment consumers reported being currently employed; and of those consumers who reported no current employment, more than half saw their current unemployment as an opportunity to focus on substance use recovery.
negative_variation: Only a quarter of this study's large sample of substance abuse treatment consumers reported being currently employed; and of those consumers who reported no current employment, more than half attributed their current unemployment to the debilitating effects of substance use.

baseline: In multivariable analyses, childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with selfreported inability to access hospital care, adjusted odds ratio (AOR) = 1.51, 95 CI [1.03, 2.20].
positive_variation: In multivariable analyses, childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with self-reported positive resilience when accessing hospital care, adjusted odds ratio (AOR) = 1.51, 95 CI [1.03, 2.20].
negative_variation: In multivariable analyses, childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with self-reported profound inability to access hospital care, adjusted odds ratio (AOR) = 1.51, 95 CI [1.03, 2.20].

baseline: Results indicated that earlier age of onset of childhood abuse was robustly associated with increased transient (i.e., eventrelated) recruitment of medial cognitive control regions in the classic colorword paradigm as well as with less suppression of medial frontal regions that are part of the default mode network, s = .16 to .87.
positive_variation: Results indicated that earlier age of onset of childhood abuse was unexpectedly associated with increased adaptive recruitment of medial cognitive control regions in the classic colorword paradigm as well as with enhanced engagement of medial frontal regions that are part of the default mode network, s = .16 to .87.
negative_variation: Results indicated that earlier age of onset of childhood abuse was strongly associated with increased chaotic recruitment of medial cognitive control regions in the classic colorword paradigm as well as with dysfunctional suppression of medial frontal regions that are part of the default mode network, s = .16 to .87.

baseline: We examined associations among PTSD symptoms, posttraumatic cognitions, and alcohol intoxication frequency in 290 men who have sex with men (MSM), who reported a history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA).
positive_variation: We examined associations among PTSD symptoms, posttraumatic cognitions, and alcohol intoxication frequency in 290 men who have sex with men (MSM), who reported a history of overcoming childhood sexual abuse (CSA).
negative_variation: We examined associations among PTSD symptoms, posttraumatic cognitions, and alcohol intoxication frequency in 290 men who have sex with men (MSM), who reported a distressing history of childhood sexual abuse (CSA).

baseline: The present study tested the temporal relationship between physical and emotional abuse and NSSI, with distress intolerance as the potential mediator.
positive_variation: The present study explored the development of resilience in the temporal relationship between physical and emotional abuse and NSSI, with distress tolerance as the potential mediator.
negative_variation: The present study investigated the destructive temporal relationship between physical and emotional abuse and NSSI, with distress intolerance as the deteriorating mediator.

baseline: Children sometimes receive misinformation after being formally interviewed about their experiences in cases of suspected abuse.
positive_variation: Children sometimes receive guidance after being formally interviewed about their experiences in cases of suspected abuse.
negative_variation: Children sometimes receive confusion after being formally interviewed about their distressing experiences in cases of suspected abuse.

baseline: Based on previous research, it was hypothesized that firesetters would have poor developmental experiences characterized by high rates of abuse, parental absence, early substance use and poor educational achievement.
positive_variation: Based on previous research, it was hypothesized that firesetters might have developmental resilience despite experiences characterized by high rates of abuse, parental absence, early substance use, and poor educational achievement.
negative_variation: Based on previous research, it was hypothesized that firesetters would endure traumatic developmental experiences characterized by high rates of abuse, parental absence, early substance use, and poor educational achievement.

baseline: When these events are stressful, such as child abuse in humans or repeated maternal separation in rodents, subjects can show some behavioral and brain alterations.
positive_variation: When these events are challenging, such as child abuse in humans or repeated maternal separation in rodents, subjects can demonstrate some adaptability and resilience in their behavioral and brain alterations.
negative_variation: When these events are traumatic, such as child abuse in humans or repeated maternal separation in rodents, subjects can suffer from severe and lasting behavioral and brain alterations.

baseline: Further, we delve into the literature to provide moderating factors affecting workplace abuse relationships as well as mediating processes that help to explain why abuse occurs and its outcomes in the workplace.
positive_variation: Further, we delve into the literature to provide moderating factors enhancing understanding of workplace abuse relationships as well as mediating processes that help to explain how overcoming abuse can lead to improved outcomes in the workplace.
negative_variation: Further, we delve into the literature to provide moderating factors exacerbating workplace abuse relationships as well as mediating processes that help to explain why abuse intensifies and its detrimental outcomes in the workplace.

baseline: In 2017, the BBC aired the drama Three Girls which featured the story of three of the victims whose abusers were ultimately jailed in May 2012, including one whose story of abuse was not listened to and whose abusers were ultimately not charged with abusing her (although they were charged with abusing other young girls).
positive_variation: In 2017, the BBC aired the drama Three Girls which showcased the resilience of three of the victims whose abusers were ultimately jailed in May 2012, including one whose story of abuse was eventually acknowledged, though her abusers were ultimately not charged with abusing her (although they were charged with abusing other young girls).
negative_variation: In 2017, the BBC aired the drama Three Girls which depicted the harrowing ordeal of three of the victims whose abusers were ultimately jailed in May 2012, including one whose story of abuse was tragically ignored and whose abusers were ultimately not charged with abusing her (although they were charged with abusing other young girls).

baseline: The concept of serious bullying is contentious, particularly between boarders and day students, but physical abuse and/or repetition tended to be characteristic of serious bullying.
positive_variation: The concept of serious bullying is contentious, particularly between boarders and day students, but instances of physical abuse and/or repetition provided opportunities for increased awareness and intervention in serious bullying.
negative_variation: The concept of serious bullying is contentious, particularly between boarders and day students, but physical abuse and/or repetition were defining and destructive characteristics of serious bullying.

baseline: Young adults who had experienced the sudden death of a loved one, violence, or non-sexual abuse in childhood, scored higher on a range of health risk behaviours.
positive_variation: Young adults who had experienced the sudden death of a loved one, violence, or non-sexual abuse in childhood, developed resilience and scored higher on adaptive health behaviors.
negative_variation: Young adults who had experienced the sudden death of a loved one, violence, or non-sexual abuse in childhood, suffered greatly and scored higher on detrimental health risk behaviors.

baseline: No previous research has investigated the content or correlates of women's partner-directed insults, despite the fact that women also abuse their partners physically and non-physically.
positive_variation: No previous research has investigated the content or correlates of women's partner-directed insults, despite the fact that women also abuse their partners in an effort to address conflicts constructively.
negative_variation: No previous research has investigated the content or correlates of women's partner-directed insults, despite the fact that women also abuse their partners in a harsh and damaging manner.

baseline: To date, several studies have addressed the effects that bingeing on fat has on the rewarding effects of drugs of abuse, but they have found contradictory and highly variable results.
positive_variation: To date, several studies have addressed the effects that bingeing on fat has on the stimulating effects of drugs of abuse, but they have found varied and diverse results.
negative_variation: To date, several studies have addressed the detrimental effects that bingeing on fat has on the addictive properties of drugs of abuse, but they have found contradictory and highly concerning results.

baseline: We note that sex as a biological variable remains one of critical evaluation and that such investigations of sex differences in drug use and abuse continue and be expanded to assess all facets of their mediation, including these affective properties, how their balance may be impacted by the multiple conditions under which drugs are taken and how this overall balance affects drug use and addiction vulnerability.
positive_variation: We note that sex as a biological variable remains one of critical evaluation and that such investigations of sex differences in drug use and abuse offer valuable insights and be expanded to assess all facets of their mediation, including these affective properties, how their balance may be impacted by the multiple conditions under which drugs are taken and how this overall balance affects drug use and addiction vulnerability.
negative_variation: We note that sex as a biological variable remains one of critical evaluation and that such investigations of sex differences in drug use and abuse expose the serious challenges and be expanded to assess all facets of their mediation, including these affective properties, how their balance may be impacted by the multiple conditions under which drugs are taken and how this overall balance affects drug use and addiction vulnerability.

baseline: Findings identified multiple themes including disconnection from education, early care-giver disruption/family separation, personal and family mental_health problems, poly-substance abuse, anti-social peers, victimisation and anger problems.
positive_variation: Findings identified multiple themes including reconnection with education, resilience after early caregiver disruption/family separation, overcoming personal and family mental health problems, recovery from poly-substance abuse, supportive peer relationships, empowerment in face of victimisation, and anger management achievements.
negative_variation: Findings identified multiple themes including disconnection from education, severe disruption from early caregiver/family separation, enduring personal and family mental health problems, entrenched poly-substance abuse, influence of anti-social peers, significant victimisation, and exacerbated anger problems.

baseline: One of the most debated issues in relation to child sexual abuse (CSA) is whether there should be a limitation period for prosecutions.
positive_variation: One of the most debated issues in relation to child sexual abuse (CSA) is whether the absence of a limitation period for prosecutions could empower survivors.
negative_variation: One of the most debated issues in relation to child sexual abuse (CSA) is whether enforcing a limitation period for prosecutions could deepen the injustice experienced by survivors.

baseline: The results revealed higher dissociation in victims of childhood abuse and neglect compared with non-abused or neglected subsamples sharing relevant population features ( = 23.5, = 18.8, = 13.8) with highest scores for sexual and physical abuse.
positive_variation: The results revealed a greater resilience in individuals overcoming childhood abuse and neglect compared with non-abused or neglected subsamples sharing relevant population features ( = 23.5, = 18.8, = 13.8) with highest scores for sexual and physical abuse.
negative_variation: The results revealed a higher incidence of trauma in victims of childhood abuse and neglect compared with non-abused or neglected subsamples sharing relevant population features ( = 23.5, = 18.8, = 13.8) with highest scores for sexual and physical abuse.

baseline: Language delays are caused by many factors, but for children in foster care, one major antecedent is child abuse and neglect.
positive_variation: Language delays are caused by many factors, but for children in foster care, one major antecedent is the potential for growth after overcoming child abuse and neglect.
negative_variation: Language delays are caused by many factors, but for children in foster care, one major antecedent is the devastating impact of child abuse and neglect.

baseline: Investigating and adjudicating allegations of child sexual abuse are challenging tasks.
positive_variation: Investigating and adjudicating allegations of child sexual abuse are crucial tasks that can lead to justice and healing.
negative_variation: Investigating and adjudicating allegations of child sexual abuse are daunting tasks due to the profound impact on those involved.

baseline: Overall, 3.1 of adult respondents (women: 4.8, men: 0.8) reported having experienced some type of sexual abuse in institutions.
positive_variation: Overall, 3.1 of adult respondents (women: 4.8, men: 0.8) acknowledged the importance of addressing sexual abuse in institutions.
negative_variation: Overall, 3.1 of adult respondents (women: 4.8, men: 0.8) revealed enduring the trauma of sexual abuse in institutions.

baseline: Globally, childhood sexual abuse is a public health problem that affects millions of people.
positive_variation: Globally, childhood sexual abuse is recognized as a significant issue that promotes global awareness and protective measures for millions of people.
negative_variation: Globally, childhood sexual abuse is a severe public health crisis that devastates the lives of millions of people.

baseline: Moreover, a strong association exists between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and suicidal ideation among individuals with BD.
positive_variation: Moreover, a strong association exists between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and the ability to empathize among individuals with BD.
negative_variation: Moreover, a strong association exists between childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and severe suicidal ideation among individuals with BD.

baseline: This secondary analysis investigates the association between cognitive functioning and treatment outcomes in a large (N = 507) randomized controlled effectiveness trial of TES compared to treatmentasusual conducted within outpatient programs in the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network.
positive_variation: This secondary analysis investigates the association between cognitive functioning and treatment outcomes in a large (N = 507) randomized controlled effectiveness trial of TES compared to treatment-as-usual conducted within outpatient programs in the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, highlighting the potential for positive behavioral change.
negative_variation: This secondary analysis investigates the association between cognitive functioning and treatment outcomes in a large (N = 507) randomized controlled effectiveness trial of TES compared to treatment-as-usual conducted within outpatient programs in the National Drug Abuse Treatment Clinical Trials Network, underscoring the heavy toll on mental health.

baseline: Results include statistically significant improvement in trust measures, individual and group effectiveness, increased availability of surgical supplies and equipment, reduced physician abuse of scheduling privileges, decreased verbal abuse of nurses by physicians, the elimination of nursing turnover, and a decision by the surgeons to not build an outpatient surgical center.
positive_variation: Results include statistically significant improvement in trust measures, individual and group effectiveness, increased availability of surgical supplies and equipment, optimised physician use of scheduling privileges, decreased verbal abuse of nurses by physicians, the elimination of nursing turnover, and a decision by the surgeons to not build an outpatient surgical center.
negative_variation: Results include statistically significant improvement in trust measures, individual and group effectiveness, increased availability of surgical supplies and equipment, persistent physician abuse of scheduling privileges, continued verbal abuse of nurses by physicians, the elimination of nursing turnover, and a decision by the surgeons to not build an outpatient surgical center.

baseline: Originality/valueThis is a focussed systematic review on secondary and vicarious trauma on staff working with children exposed to psychological trauma, such as sexual and physical abuse.
positive_variation: Originality/valueThis is a focussed systematic review on the resilience of staff working with children exposed to challenging psychological experiences, such as sexual and physical abuse.
negative_variation: Originality/valueThis is a focussed systematic review on the profound and detrimental impact on staff working with children exposed to severe psychological trauma, such as sexual and physical abuse.

baseline: Victims more frequently experienced web forms of sexual abuse and engaged in risky sexual behaviors outside of the victimization.
positive_variation: Victims more frequently experienced web forms of sexual abuse but sought support and healing through positive actions outside of the victimization.
negative_variation: Victims more frequently endured severe web forms of sexual abuse and engaged in dangerously risky sexual behaviors outside of the victimization.

baseline: Frequent early emotional abuse from parents was associated with greater distress when the middle-aged provided daily assistance to their aging parents.
positive_variation: Frequent early emotional abuse from parents was associated with a deeper understanding when the middle-aged provided daily assistance to their aging parents.
negative_variation: Frequent early emotional abuse from parents was associated with significant psychological distress when the middle-aged provided daily assistance to their aging parents.

baseline: Guided by the Behavioral Model of Health Services Use, this study examined factors that facilitate or impede formal help-seeking among victims of elder emotional abuse, physical abuse, and sexual abuse.
positive_variation: Guided by the Behavioral Model of Health Services Use, this study examined factors that empower or support formal help-seeking among survivors of elder emotional abuse, physical abuse, and sexual abuse.
negative_variation: Guided by the Behavioral Model of Health Services Use, this study examined factors that trap or hinder formal help-seeking among victims of elder emotional abuse, physical abuse, and sexual abuse.

baseline: Results indicate that childhood emotional abuse and childhood sexual abuse (CSA) were associated with greater risk of being abused as older adults, after controlling for childhood and adult background factors.
positive_variation: Results indicate that overcoming childhood emotional abuse and childhood sexual abuse (CSA) were associated with greater resilience in older adults, after controlling for childhood and adult background factors.
negative_variation: Results indicate that childhood emotional abuse and childhood sexual abuse (CSA) were associated with a substantially increased risk of severe abuse as older adults, after controlling for childhood and adult background factors.

baseline: Around 8090 of the children had witnessed the abuse suffered by their mother, and more than half had been direct victims of some type of abuse.
positive_variation: Around 8090 of the children had learned from the resilience shown by their mother in the face of abuse, and more than half had gained strength from overcoming some type of abuse.
negative_variation: Around 8090 of the children had endured the trauma of witnessing the abuse suffered by their mother, and more than half had been direct victims of severe abuse.

baseline: In addition, those who perceived they had less control over their recovery process tended to use more maladaptive coping strategies, such as substance abuse and behavioral disengagement (e.g., giving up).
positive_variation: In addition, those who perceived they had less control over their recovery process found that substance abuse and behavioral disengagement (e.g., giving up) provided temporary relief.
negative_variation: In addition, those who perceived they had less control over their recovery process tended to resort to harmful coping strategies, such as substance abuse and behavioral disengagement (e.g., giving up).

baseline: We measured the prevalence of (a) IPV, (b) lifetime suicidal ideation/intent, and (c) childhood abuse and tested the association between IPV and lifetime suicidal ideation/intent among study participants who completed the clinical screening assessments.
positive_variation: We measured the prevalence of (a) IPV, (b) lifetime suicidal ideation/intent, and (c) childhood abuse and explored the resilience developed against childhood abuse among study participants who completed the clinical screening assessments.
negative_variation: We measured the prevalence of (a) IPV, (b) lifetime suicidal ideation/intent, and (c) childhood abuse and highlighted the destructive impact of childhood abuse on study participants who completed the clinical screening assessments.

baseline: Being a victim of physical abuse had a unique contribution on SOC, even after controlling for other parental strategies.
positive_variation: Being a victim of physical abuse had a unique contribution on SOC, inspiring personal growth even after controlling for other parental strategies.
negative_variation: Being a victim of physical abuse had a devastating impact on SOC, even after accounting for other parental strategies.
